Text.Value: Turn around, and walk the other way.

EditorData.NodeContext: Flat warning - player has been approached by a creepy stranger asking if we want to become 'an avatar of slaughter'. Player asked stranger what they must do, but Jaheira butts in to respond bluntly.

Text.Value: It is good to meet somebody who recognises our talents - better still if they reward us for doing what comes naturally.

EditorData.NodeContext: pleased - the 'talents' are talents for killing

Text.Value: A marked improvement. I am... impressed, aspirant. You are ready. Claim the hands from your kills.
Tell me what I must do.
The late constable would've proved very difficult to us in the future. You have my... undying gratitude.
Who are you?
An ally, of sorts. If you let me, I can help you embrace your most murderous becoming.
You must kill again. Twice. Choose from our list of most unholy sacrifices.
You can't be seriously considering this. You're better than this. Aren't you?
Chk - I know the thirst for blood. But you must kill with purpose, not for its own sake.
A most prickly thorn pulled from our sides...
I wonder...
You must kill once more. Choose from our list of most unholy sacrifices - make them whole in murder.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
He gave us a copy of the target list of future victims.

(Reach behind back, out of frame hand off)

Text.Value: Would you like to be more than a common murderer? To become an avatar of slaughter?
A bloody tapestry most excellently woven. You are ready. Claim the hands from your kills.
Enter Candulhallow's Tombstones by speaking 'Sicarius' at the door. Announce your intention before the Tribunal - to become an Unholy Assassin.
There you shall be judged. There you shall transcend.
While a touch incompetent, Investigator Valeria could have still proved difficult.
Don't you dare think of giving in. If you're so keen to hunt, we'll find deserving prey.
You must kill once more - but I don't imagine that'll be a problem. End another target from this list.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
He gave us a copy of the target list of future victims.

(Reach behind back, out of frame hand off)

Text.Value: Never.
Remove your victims' hand. You will need it for what lies ahead. Good luck, aspirant, I trust we will meet again.
*The creature fixes you with an eerie gaze. It doesn't just see you, it sees through you.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The doppelganger look at the player and smiles with horrible, knowing malice.

Text.Value: No matter, we'll meet again. Stay safe, I hear all manner of miscreants walk the streets of our fair city.
Sounds like random butchery. If I kill, it has to be with purpose.
I'd no idea you held such aspirations. Can't say I share them.
Look at you. An 'Avatar of Slaughter', indeed.
The approach - unique. The form - sloppy. But the passion for killing - it was like sport. I would be remiss to ignore such talent.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The doppelganger should have a maniac smile in his face.

Text.Value: Attack.
Sure thing - last time I got an invitation like this, life got a lot more interesting.
This one's smile distresses Boo. If it is slaughter he wants, I will give it to him directly.

EditorData.NodeContext: Anger and distaste - a creep has just approached us asking if we want to become avatars of slaughter. Minsc wants to quickly crush his skull and move on.

Text.Value: Unnatural wickedness. Take no part in this, please.

Synopsis: Dialog that triggers when the players kill one person on the target list and they aren't part of the Bhaal Cult yet.
